description: Rumor templates that captains share during fleet activities

rumors.text: They say there's a dead warp lane out past Theta-9. Ships go in, comms go silent, but the hulls drift back... empty.
A hauler jumped from Kess to Voral. Took ten seconds on their clock. Station logs said they'd been gone three days.
Some pilots pick up comms in the tunnel that haven't been sent yet. Echoes from the future, they call them.
There's a gate out in the Drift that doesn't match any known design. Pre-collapse, maybe older. Nobody's tried to activate it.
Station Zero. First structure ever built out here. They say it's still running on its original reactor, buried inside an asteroid.
Deep scanners found a spire made of something that reflects every frequency. Mirrors everything back. Can't get a read on it.
Signal 47-17. Repeating pulse from an empty grid square. No ship, no structure, no debris. Just the signal, every 90 seconds.
Miners in the Korvan belt swear the rocks hum before they crack. Not vibration — actual harmonic tones.
There's a frequency nobody uses. 1142.7. Supposedly if you listen long enough, you hear voices. Old ones.
Captain Maren's fleet vanished during the Solari Expansion. Pilots still report seeing her ship on long-range scans. Always just out of reach.
There's a hauler that runs the Deadlight Corridor solo. No escort, no weapons. Never been touched. Nobody knows why.
Keldari veterans say if you salute a wreck, the pilot's ghost won't follow your ship. Superstition, sure. But I still do it.
Thirteen jumps without docking. That's the limit. After that, the void starts watching back. Every old pilot knows this.
Ion blooms have been flaring up near the Aurelian border. Wrecks sensors, scrambles nav. Some say it's getting worse.
The Dust Tide rolls through every few cycles. Fills whole systems with particulate. Good for hiding. Bad for everything else.
Black auroras near the Rift. Not just dark sky — instruments read negative luminosity. Shouldn't be possible.
When a star goes quiet before a flare, old Aurelian pilots call it a whisper. They say the star's deciding what to burn.
